items.title: Sprint cadence or workflow
items.content:
Join the team’s rhythm by attending stand ups, planning, and retros. Clarify sprint goals and what success looks like. Pair with design or engineering early so content decisions land before development starts.

Keep a lightweight backlog for content tasks. Surface blockers daily and capture decisions in the same place your team tracks work.

  • Agree on Definition of Ready and Done for content
  • Timebox reviews and set who can approve
  • Demo content changes alongside the feature

items.title: Simplifying complexity
items.content:
Cut through complexity by framing a single user outcome. Remove anything that doesn’t serve that outcome.

  • Start from the user’s verb: apply, pay, book, renew
  • Chunk long tasks into clear, named steps
  • Prefer plain language over internal jargon
  • Show examples and edge cases only when needed

When in doubt, reduce reading: fewer words, more clarity.

items.title: Working with subject matter experts
items.content:
Meet subject matter experts with a short agenda and a shared document. Ask them to walk a realistic scenario rather than describe the system.

  • Capture source links and dates for every fact
  • Confirm the exact words users will see
  • Record decisions and who approved them

Follow up with a redline or prototype to make feedback fast.
